intro: Restio distylis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in Mediterranean climates. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Restio distylis is adapted to dry conditions and is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value.
